subject: Photography
title: Instagram Changes Everything
description: A 60-second lesson on Instagram Changes Everything.

hook.text: In 2010, a photo-sharing app launched with filters that made your lunch look like art. The world was hooked.

buildup.text: Instagram let anyone apply vintage filters to phone photos and share them instantly. Photography went social.

discovery.text: Within two years, Facebook bought Instagram for one billion dollars. It had thirteen employees.

twist.text: Instagram democratized photography but also homogenized it. Everyone chased the same filters, the same aesthetic.

climax.text: Photography became less about skill and more about sharing. The audience became as important as the image.

punchline.text: Photography used to be about moments. Now it's about likes.

quiz.question: How did Instagram change photography culture?
options: It shifted focus from skill to sharing and social validation
